intro: Cyrtandra hobdyi, commonly known as Hobdy's mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as rainforests and streamside areas. It has opposite, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Cyrtandra hobdyi is considered a rare and endangered species.
